Articles.Content:
> 
> and the idiotic trolls can taste banhammer.

Ooh, what does it taste like?

Not the only popular youtuber to release a video on release day.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/MHEyKuNSDO0?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Except the version is 0.90

Oh no exposure to a large audience might taint our precious forum!

I've seen several PewDiePie videos, and never understood the abject hate. He's annoying at the start and end and if I never hear the word "bro" again I'll have still heard it to many times, but dude's just doing what he likes and getting paid for it.

I wonder if this is the real reason they rushed to 1.0

[/conspiracy]

[/notreally]

I'm reading all those comments on Youtube... My prediction is that now lots of annoying "youtubers" will make KSP videos of low gameplay quality (moronic designs and explosions) and it will cause a (hopefully) temporary surge in crazy loopy kids on the forum.

Let's hope they go to reddit.com and stay there. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

I appreciate the KSP public exposure, though. That is a good thing.
Honestly, he did better than I expected...

> 
> Ooh, what does it taste like?

It probably tastes like guilt-flavored bread ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Anyways, there are already a lot of young people playing KSP. Hopefully,the people coming in will be mature, and patient. (Please do not be "hao do i go to spayz?" "lol poods brougt me hre bros!!")

I don't really watch gaming videos unless it's a tutorial or previews videos, though.

It will be like the September that Never Ended...

Well, until something else shiny appears.

Squad will still have their money either way, so we just have to weather the storm~

Dodger also did a promoted video:

[https://youtu.be/afV_73qICiQ](https://youtu.be/afV_73qICiQ)

No problem for me, they properly disclosed the whole thing, and the money invested will help potencial fans to know about the game.

So, good job Squad.

Well, hopefully, the (relatively few) people in Pewdiepie's audience with a proper intrest in space will pick up the game with the intention of not using it as a Micheal Bay simulator, and then we'll have some new Trainees.

We're all noobs at 1.0, though. ;P

> 
> Well, hopefully, the (relatively few) people in Pewdiepie's audience with a proper intrest in space will pick up the game with the intention of not using it as a Micheal Bay simulator, and then we'll have some new Trainees.
> We're all noobs at 1.0, though. ;P

Trainees! Woohoo! Unless they are the kind of people that just came because pewdiepie did a video on KSP. I think the moderators will ban them pretty fast though. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> Ooh, what does it taste like?

The combined satisfaction of the entire KSP moderating team being shoved down your throat. \*shudders\*

I'm not sure I want to see this, but I kinda do... ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)

> 
> We're all noobs at 1.0, though. ;P

Speak for yourself, I've played a lot with FAR and DRE (both together and separately for each), KIDS, Kethane, and my *Horrible Nerf* ***Enhanced*** makes the 1.0 nerfs look like a walk in the park. (Regular HN is roughly on par with the 1.0 changes)

1.0 feels like playing my standard install, only a bit more forgiving (the new aero is less torque-y than FAR somehow).

I think it's great KSPs getting a little more publicity.

I'm hoping Pewdiepie does more and even tries a Mun landing.

> 
> We better seek cover while the KSP community gets bombarded by 12 year old fanboys

A huge chunk of the KSP playerbase alreadys fits that description, so meh?

> 
> WHAT Lets see the sales graph after this!!!!???????

Youtubers like him have next to no influence in sales figures most of the time.

I cringed all the way through the video, let it be known. He did reach space once, in the cinematic countdown (I assume a break where he went to learn). 

I see it 2 ways: 

1. Massive flood of really inexperienced 9-13 year olds flooding the forums with " L0L Kerbalz, omg guz I killed JebZ wiTh a Boosterz" or " I press space to space, right". I don't like this option 

2. Free? (I think he said he was sponsored by Squad) advertising and much more people interested in the game, cane me helped by the lovely people here.

> 
> A huge chunk of the KSP playerbase alreadys fits that description, so meh?

No, most of us are 40-year-old fanboys~

First of all, one can be a fan of both KSP and Pewdiepie (such as me!). There is no fanboying

Second of all, the video description didn't mention it being a tutorial, introduction, showing off features, ... . And with tons of other youtubers such as beloved Scott Manley, we don't need Pewds doing anything like that.

I always hoped he would do a KSP video, I even expected it to be like this! No harm done! Maybe he'd do some actual missions in the future, maybe he wouldn't. No. Harm. Done!

> 
> First of all, one can be a fan of both KSP and Pewdiepie (such as me!). There is no fanboying
> Second of all, the video description didn't mention it being a tutorial, introduction, showing off features, ... . And with tons of other youtubers such as beloved Scott Manley, we don't need Pewds doing anything like that.
> 
> I always hoped he would do a KSP video, I even expected it to be like this! No harm done! Maybe he'd do some actual missions in the future, maybe he wouldn't. No. Harm. Done!

Precisely. He even failed to horribly mutilate the game, which is good! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

It reminds me of the first few days of the 0.18 demo, where I couldn't get to space for the life of me.

It was very hard and painful to watch the video. He is basically misnaming (is that a word ? not sure) jeb, bill and bob, doing a lot of retarded stuff that new players do not even do (tutorials, for squads sake) and i dont think that he even reached space in his video... (not sure,. couldnt stand watching till the end) 

HOW is this >crap< whorth 1.9 million views ? Even the video editing is ugly

It was a good video (from a sales perspective).

 He made a lot of newbie mistakes, blew up a lot of rockets, and eventually made orbit.

 Most importantly, he said he really got into it and had fun with it.

> 
> Interestingly, Jacksepticeye's (he's another popular youtuber and knows poods) first KSP video (or two) was kind of like that. Then he started watching Scott Manley, learned to orbit, made it to the moon, and even learned how to dock. So who knows?

He used infinite fuel for the Mun landing and probably other things
... is a pewdiepie?

> 
> HOW is this >crap< whorth 1.9 million views ? Even the video editing is ugly

That's how much views all his videos get
NOOO! Not him!
